info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 07 at 12:45PM CDT by NWS Central Illinois
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Crawford County through 130 PM CDT... At 1244 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Oblong, or 10 miles west of Robinson, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Hardinville around 1255 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Robinson, New Hebron, Flat Rock and Palestine. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
